ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this course for others. In part, because of the benefits of cultural theories for studies in the humanities.

Rel Studies 770 is a very basic introductory theory course. I would NOT recommend this course for PhD students. The course was billed as one about methodology -- I was under the impression that we would be talking about how different disciplines make use of cultural theory. Instead, it was a very basic lecture course in which the instructor attempted to explain large concepts ("culture," "class," etc.) each week.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Very practically oriented; accent of methodology added clear connections for research projects
I began this course with little, to know, knowledge of the material, and having finished the course I feel that I have stronger command of the material.
This course offered the opportunity to write a paper that was important to my discipline, and that I plan to use as a basis for future research.
